body.p: In the month of September 1863. two judgments were rendered in the name of the Commonwealth of Ky in the Madison Circuit Court against a man named Alexr. Hudson, which were replevied by Adam Rogers one for $66.55/100 the other for $72.55/100 on the 28th September 1863. Hudson is insolvent and worthless -- Old Mr Rogers is about 83 years old, and has been weak in mind and body both for several years, wholly unfit for business, and besides has been almost ruined by this war, when the battle on the 30th August 1862 was fought near this town, His house was used as hospital for our wounded Union soldiers for nearly two months -- He was forced to leave his home -- His servant had to cook, wash, & wait on the sick and wounded in his house, being from 25 to 50 in number. His cattle were killed for beef, his grain consumed, & his farm despoiled -- The Rebels carried off nearly all his horses, and now executions to pay the judgments af'd have been levied on his tittle personally

You will confer a lasting obligation on him by remitting the amount of the two bonds aforesaid less
fees & costs. & you will be sustained in so doing, by all who know the facts -- please act in this petition at once & favorably, & we will ever pray.

8th May 1865.
J. W. Caperton
Curtis F. Burnam
Wm Chenault
S. Parish Sherff Madison Co. Ky
T Williams D. S. M. C
R E Little D C M C C
